remarks: There is no "surprise" in a for-all with implication if there exists a value where the antecedent is true.  This is one way to prevent for-all with implication from allowing anything.  For a contrast, see ~ alimp-surprise .  The allsome quantifier also counters this problem, see ~ df-alsi .  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 27-Oct-2018.)
statement: alimp-no-surprise $p |- -. ( A. x ( ph -> ps ) /\ A. x ( ph -> -. ps ) /\ E. x ph ) $.
